data.title: Florence (Flo) Hewat Obituary - Lunenburg, Nova Scotia
data.meta_description: Hewat, Florence E. (Flo), died peacefully in New Minas NS, former long time resident of Lunenburg NS, on November 25, 2009 at the age of 101.   Florence Elizabeth was born in Yarmouth on March 29, 1908, daughter of Prescott and Mabel Baker, granddaughter of  the Hon. L.E. Baker, MLA, Yarmouth, NS.   Educated at King’s Hall, Compton, Quebec, Flo returned to Yarmouth and after completing a business course worked for General Electric. In 1931 she married Dr. William A. Hewat and settled in Lunenburg for the next 75 years.  A keen and competitive golfer, Flo was President of the Ladies Section of The Bluenose Golf Club on several occasions and ultimately was made an Honorary Life Member. Flo also served as president of the NS Women’s Golf Association.  Her other interests included politics and the Liberal Party, Ladies Curling Club (President), Regent and 75 year member of the Bluenose Chapter of the IODE, member of the Lunenburg Art Gallery, member of the Heritage Society and the Fisherman’s Memorial Hospital Auxiliary.  As a faithful member of St. John’s Anglican Church, Flo was involved with the Ladies Aid, the Little Helpers Society and the Women’s Auxiliary (past president).   She was predeceased by her husband Dr. W.A. Hewat (Bill), by her sisters Constance Ketchum, Ottawa; Dora Fuller, Hartford, CT; and her brothers Loren Baker, Yarmouth NS and George Baker, Chester, NS and most recently by her daughter, Gretchen McCulloch, New Minas, NS.   She is survived by her daughter Patricia Robertson (Dr. Douglas) Toronto/Corkum’s Island, seven grand children Bruce, Alex, Janet, Jamie, Susan, Bill, Jennifer and 16 great grandchildren.  Florence spent her last years being lovingly cared for by Jocelyn Askew and helpers at Arbordale Senior Care Home in New Minas, NS.   Visitation will be held on Sunday, November 29 2009 3-5pm at the Dana L. Sweeny Funeral Home, 11213 Hwy. # 3, Lunenburg. A funeral service will be held at 11:00 am Tuesday December 1 at St. John’s Anglican Church, Lunenburg , Rev. Michael Mitcell, officiating. Interment will be in Hillcrest Cemetery, Lunenburg, with reception to follow in the church hall.  Flowers from the immediate family only, memorial donations may be made to Fishermen’s Memorial Hospital, St. John’s Anglican Church or to a charity of your choice.  www.sweenyfuneralhome.ca

We are here to help you. If you have need of our services, please call us, day or night. Or, if you prefer, you can fill out the form on the right.

Pre-Arrange Your Funeral

Are you thinking about pre-planning your funeral? Pre-planning is the best way to choose how you're remembered, to ease the emotional and financial burden on your loved ones, to protect yourself from rising funeral costs, and to let your family know your final wishes.

Click here to learn more, or fill out this form and we will contact you.

Site Search

If you are looking for information on a particular topic, or if you are looking for a loved one who has been entrusted to our care, you can use the form below to narrow down your search.

Site Search

Order Flowers

Ordering flowers from our site ensures that your order will reach us or the family in a timely manner, and your gesture of support will remain acknowledged in the Book of Memories™ for future generations. We only work with local florists so we can maintain the sense of urgency and quality of your selections. We thank you for helping to support the family during their time of need, and will fondly remember your kind gesture.

Click Here

Order Tribute Gifts

We respect the sensitivity and dignity that comes with ordering tribute gifts from the funeral home. It is for this reason that we have attempted to design our online Sympathy Store with the utmost respect to the family and the deceased. We hope you find this service helpful during your time of need and would welcome any comments or suggestions you might have to help us serve our communities better.
